title: How to Make a Box Knot Scoubidou

steps.title: Link the strings together at the middle.
steps.content: Link the strings together at the middle. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Put the bottom red string over the top red string.
steps.content: Put the bottom red string over the top red string. Do the same with the green string, except use the top string. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Put the red string, (the one at the side), over the red loop.
steps.content: Put the red string, (the one at the side), over the red loop. Then thread it through the green loop. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Do the same with the side green loop.
steps.content: Do the same with the side green loop. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Put the green strings over, as shown in the picture.
steps.content: Put the green strings over, as shown in the picture.

steps.title: Thread the red strings through the green loops.
steps.content: Thread the red strings through the green loops.

steps.title: Pull tight.
steps.content: Pull tight. Keep knotting to desired length.

steps.title: Place one strand horizontal and another vertical on top of it.
steps.content: Place one strand horizontal and another vertical on top of it. Make sure they intersect at the middle of each strand. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Put your finger on top of the intersection.
steps.content: Put your finger on top of the intersection. Take the ends of the horizontal strand and cross them over your finger. [6] X Research source Bring them to the opposite ends.

steps.title: Weave the vertical strands through the horizontal.
steps.content: Weave the vertical strands through the horizontal. Let the vertical ends cross over your finger and under the horizontal strand on the farther side. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Pull all four ends to tighten into a knot.
steps.content: Pull all four ends to tighten into a knot.

steps.title: Make two loops over the center with the horizontal strand.
steps.content: Make two loops over the center with the horizontal strand. Bend the strand nearest opposite you to make one loop. [8] X Research source Bend the other strand nearest to you to make another loop opposite you.

steps.title: Pass one vertical string over the horizontal loop nearest it.
steps.content: Pass one vertical string over the horizontal loop nearest it. Then thread it through the second loop farthest it.

steps.title: Pass the second vertical string over the horizontal loop nearest it.
steps.content: Pass the second vertical string over the horizontal loop nearest it. Then thread it through the second loop farthest it.

steps.title: Pull all four strings together.
steps.content: Pull all four strings together. Continue for as long as you need the knot to be.
